byline.original: From Our Own Correspondent.Correspondence of the New-York Times.Correspondence of the New-York Times:

headline.main: FROM THE PACIFIC COAST.; ARRIVAL OF THE CHAMPION. $1,100,693 IN TREASURE. IMPORTANT NEWS FROM NEW-GRANADA. The Triumphant Entry of Mosquera Into Bogota. NEW-GRANADA. Important from Bogota The Triumphant Entry of Mosquera Total Defeat of the Old Government Forces Letter from Mosquera to the Governor of Panama Censure of United States Consul Corwin, &c. JAMAICA. The "Saladin" to take the Place of the "Zulec" The Holt Contract Political Affairs The New Ministerial Adviser A StormySession Approaching The Public Departments Their Mismanagement, and Exposeof Corruption, &c. Couduct of the War Reliance of the South on Northern Divisions.

docs.snippet: United States Marshal SANDFORD, of Rhode Island, arrived here on Wednesday morning, with Mr. JOHN W. ANDREWS, a resident of New-Orleans, whom he arrested in Providence, charged with being an officer in the Louisiana Militia, and actively engaged in...

headline.main: LOCAL MILITARY MOVEMENTS.; ARREST OF SECESSIONISTS--A QUESTION OF IDENTITY. ANOTHER CANDIDATE FOR FORT LAFAYETTE. THE THIRTY-SEVENTH REGIMENT, N.Y.V. THE CONSTITUTION GRAYS. THE WASHINGTON ZOUAVES. THE TWELFTH REGIMENT, N.Y.S.M. A BATTERY OF JAMES' GUNS

docs.lead_paragraph: United States Marshal SANDFORD, of Rhode Island, arrived here on Wednesday morning, with Mr. JOHN W. ANDREWS, a resident of New-Orleans, whom he arrested in Providence, charged with being an officer in the Louisiana Militia, and actively engaged in the rebel movement.

headline.main: A Strange Case.; A MAN CHARGED WITH PERSUADING A WOMAN TO COMMIT SUICIDE, IN ORDER THAT HE MIGHT STEAL HER MONEY.

docs.snippet: On Saturday last Mr. McDANIELS, in the employ of the Government, arrested ISAAC YOUNG and another person, for participating in a disloyal meeting held at Rockville. They are now in the hands of the Provost-Marshal of this Division.

headline.main: FROM GEN. BANKS' COLUMN.; FULL PREPARATIONS FOR THE REBELS

docs.lead_paragraph: On Saturday last Mr. McDANIELS, in the employ of the Government, arrested ISAAC YOUNG and another person, for participating in a disloyal meeting held at Rockville. They are now in the hands of the Provost-Marshal of this Division.

headline.main: A CURIOUS DEVELOPMENT.; THE BURNING OF THE CATALINE AT FORTRESS MONROE. ARREST OF HER CLERK FOR ARSON--INTERESTING FACTS RESPECTING HER CHARTER-- PROCEEDINGS IN A POLICE COURT. THE REBEL PRIVATEERS. STATEMENT OF CAPT. WELCH, OF SCHOONER MARY ALICE. THE PRIVATEER SUMTER. THE CAPTURED PRIZES. CASE OF THE BRIG CUBA, ONE OF THE SUMTER'S PRIZES. CAMP SHERMAN, AT HEMPSTEAD, L.I. PROGRESS OF GEN. SHERMAN'S BRIGADE-- INSPECTION OF THE THIRD REGIMENT NEW-HAMPSHIRE VOLUNTEERS-- DESCRIPTION OF THE CAMP, ETC. MAINE TROOPS EN ROUTE. MOVEMENTS OF HON. GIDEON WELLES. THE MARYLAND SECESSIONISTS.
AFFAIRS ON THE UPPER POTOMAC.; MAGICAL EFFECT OF SPHERICAL CASE SHOT. BREAKING UP OF A MISSISSIPPI REGIMENT. THE CAPTURE OF FORT HATTERAS. NAVAL AND MILITARY INTELLIGENCE.

docs.snippet: There were no movements of the forces in the vicinity of Washington yesterday, either National or rebel. There was considerable skirmishing, however, on Monday night, near the Chain Bridge.
docs.lead_paragraph: There were no movements of the forces in the vicinity of Washington yesterday, either National or rebel. There was considerable skirmishing, however, on Monday night, near the Chain Bridge.

headline.main: ANOTHER RAILROAD DISASTER.; SEVEN OF THE IRA HARRIS CAVALRY KILLED. THE NEW-JERSEY SIXTH REGIMENT. FROM FORTRESS MONROE. THE MAINE STATE ELECTION. SEIZURES UNDER THE CONFISCATION ACT. GEN. BUTLER'S MOVEMENTS. RUMORED RESIGNATION. UNION MEETING IN BRIDGEPORT. MILITARY AND NAVAL INTELLIGENCE. CAMP WINFIELD SCOTT.

docs.lead_paragraph: Yesterday afternoon two or three rear cars of a train containing a detachment of the Ira Harris Cavalry, of New-York, under Col. KILPATRICK, was thrown from the track of the Northern Central Railroad, near Cockeysville, through the criminal care lessness of the engineer. Four soldiers were instantly killed and several wounded, three mortally.
